verses.roman:
dui-bhāi viṣaya-tyāgera upāya sṛjila
bhau-dhana diyā dui brāhmaṇe varila

synonyms: dui-bhāi—the two brothers; viṣaya-tyāgera—of giving up material activities; upāya sṛjila—discovered a means; bahu-dhana—much money; diyā—paying; dui brāhmaṇe—two brāhmaṇas; varila—appointed.
translation: The two brothers devised a means whereby they could give up their material activities. For this purpose, they appointed two brāhmaṇas and paid them a large amount of money.
